results.title: A Voice for the wilderness
results.creator_credit: Michael Balson, Chris Wilcox and Yowie Films
results.brief_description: An examination of rainforests and remaining wilderness areas focusing on the untouched forests (the Antarctic beech forests of the Upper Hastings River Valley of New South Wales) to show the importance of the conservation movement in preserving our wilderness areas. Studies the attitudes to land use from Aboriginal occupancy through the struggle of white settlers and the golden age of timber to the present day when conservation has become a powerful voice world-wide. Outlines the benefits of a rainforest ecology to man and the effects of the depletion of rainforests on the rest of the ecosystem. Examines the relationship of mill workers to their jobs. Uses archival footage and the words of Henry Thoreau from his book “Walden”. Narrated by John Downes.

results.title: A visit with Anne Rice [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Pat Corbett, Anne Rice, Pat Corbitt and Corbitt Design Inc
results.brief_description: Best-selling author of “The Vampire Chronicles”, Anne Rice, discusses subjects that have had a profound affect on her both as an individual and a writer. She focuses mainly on her home town of New Orleans, and covers such diverse but related areas of interest including the people of New Orleans, churches, Catholicism, houses and architecture, religious art, festivals, and death. Includes still images of properties and locations used in some of her novels.

results.title: A Visit to the Hsin Hua School in Peking (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Records some of the activities in an elementary school in Beijing from playground games and classes to involvement in a cooperative manufacturing project.
Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: A Visit to puppets
results.brief_description: The Baj Teatr, Warsaw, is one of nineteen Polish puppet theatres for children. Everything at the Baj has a professional appearance - the finely constructed puppets, sets, beautiful costumes - all made by the theatre’s staff of artists and actors. A short play is presented, using puppets seen in construction earlier in the film. Commentary spoken by Lucie Gray.

results.title: A Visit to Ireland
results.creator_credit: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: The film shows various aspects of life in Southern Ireland. Covers the following: typical farm activities, harvesting grain, thatching with straw, peat cutting; scenes of Blarney Castle and of the Blarney Stone; life in Dublin; carding, spinning and weaving in the home; the churches of Ireland; recreational activities.

results.title: A Visit to a sheep farm
results.creator_credit: Dell King and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description:
An overview of activities on a sheep farm, following two children on a tour. Shows rounding up, tail docking, shearing, different fleece types, and takes a quick look at the process of converting raw wool into marketable commodities.
Shitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: A Visit to a ....: a sheep farm, a dairy, an airport, a container port
results.creator_credit: Yvonne MacKay, Dell King, Dave Gibson and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description: A compilation tape containing programs about two children who visit a dairy farm, a sheep farm, an airport and a container port. Reveals the daily and seasonal life of each venue.

results.title: A Visit from St Nicholas: a Coronet fantasy
results.creator_credit: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films

results.title: A Visit from space
results.brief_description: Animated film about the adventures of a little girl who meets an inhabitant of a distant planet. It is based on the new world of space as seen through the fantasy of a modern child.
